channel.title: Side Kick Classes
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Side Kick Classes" - Should the Tasha's sidekick options be added to this website

item.title: Re: Side Kick Classes
item.content:encoded: I'll throw one up then sticky it, can be a discussion place for what we want to add to it.

item.title: Re: Side Kick Classes
item.content:encoded:
Yes! The misc section is here!
Oh lord ive got a bunch of stuff to work on then,

Should I start a new thread to list a buncha different things that should be part of the misc section?

item.title: Re: Side Kick Classes
item.content:encoded:
Added a new section to the main page called 'Miscellaneous' with the sidekick classes on the test home page.
http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/home:test

item.title: Re: Side Kick Classes
item.content:encoded:
Oh man! That's been bugging me for a while! I actually just made this account so I could add it to the site myself. Thanks for the work, friend.

And now, is there anything we can do beyond hope that an admin/mod puts the sidekicks on the front page? What other pages do I not know about since they're not on the front page? Is there some sort of directory of all pages in the wiki?

Looking forward to more knowledge of the site!

item.title: Re: Side Kick Classes
item.content:encoded:
Sorry it took me so long to finish this off! But here they are:

http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/sidekicks
- http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/sidekick:expert
- http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/sidekick:spellcaster
- http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/sidekick:warrior

item.title: Re: Side Kick Classes
item.content:encoded: I don't see a problem with adding these. Could add a new category in between the Wizard & Items categories.

item.title: Side Kick Classes
item.content:encoded:
So, this website, in my eyes atleast, is a large collection of all the dnd content available to players. This brings me to my question, should we add the side kick classes?

For those who dont know, the side kick classes were a set of options that were released in Tashas, which were a set of 3 NPC classes, intended to fill the role of giving a non player character level progression and features, without the complexity of classes and subclasses.

Personally, I feel like they should belong on the wiki, due to them being class options. However, they should be within their own category, probably towards the bottom of the main page. What are your thoughts?
